channel.description: Recent content in Metrics on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: github: Copilot usage metrics now includes enterprise-level GitHub Copilot CLI activity
item.description:
GitHub Copilot enterprise usage metrics now include GitHub Copilot CLI telemetry, expanding what’s counted in enterprise-level reporting.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot metrics is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub Copilot usage metrics are now generally available, providing a centralized view of team adoption and usage.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot metrics report URLs update
item.description:
GitHub Copilot usage metrics API download URLs are now served from a new endpoint; report data, API contract, and response schema are unchanged.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Org-level metrics API now includes pull request throughput metric parity
item.description:
GitHub expanded the organization-level Copilot Usage Metrics API to add pull request activity metrics, bringing the org-level endpoints closer to other metrics parity.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Organization-level Copilot usage metrics dashboard available in public preview
item.description:
GitHub has added an organization-level GitHub Copilot usage metrics dashboard in public preview, expanding access beyond enterprise-only dashboards.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Pull request throughput and time to merge available in Copilot usage metrics API
item.description:
GitHub Copilot usage metrics APIs now include pull request outcomes metrics, enabling org-level reporting on PR throughput and time to merge.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot metrics in GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot metrics — including usage data, code generation dashboards, and a metrics API — are available in public preview for GitHub Enterprise Cloud customers with data residency, enabling organizations to store and query Copilot metrics according to regional compliance requirements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Closing down notice of legacy Copilot metrics APIs
item.description:
GitHub is closing down three legacy Copilot metrics APIs as it transitions to newer, more comprehensive usage metrics endpoints. Support for the legacy APIs will be limited, and users should plan to migrate to the updated endpoints.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise-level pull request activity now included in Copilot Usage Metrics in public preview
item.description:
GitHub has added enterprise-level pull request activity metrics to Copilot Usage Metrics (now in public preview), letting organizations see PR creation and review activity across the enterprise and how GitHub Copilot participates in that workflow.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: More accurate Copilot Autofix usage metrics on security overview
item.description:
GitHub updated the security overview dashboard to provide more accurate metrics for CodeQL alerts fixed using Copilot autofixes by refining how autofix usage is calculated, improving visibility into adoption and effectiveness without changing the fixes themselves.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Track Copilot code generation metrics in a dashboard
item.description:
GitHub added Copilot lines-of-code (LoC) metrics to the code generation insights dashboard. Administrators can view these metrics for their enterprise via the Enterprises page.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Load Balancer bandwidth metrics now support Protocol dimension
item.description:
Azure Load Balancer bandwidth metrics are now generally available with a new metric dimension named Protocol. Byte, Packet, and SYN Count metrics in the Azure portal include the Protocol dimension (TCP traffic shown as Protocol=6), enabling protocol-level metric views.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Container network metrics filtering in Advanced Container Networking Services for (ACNS) for AKS
item.description:
Azure’s Advanced Container Networking Services (ACNS) for AKS now offers container network metrics filtering in public preview. The feature lets customers reduce ingestion of unnecessary network telemetry from containers to lower storage costs and declutter monitoring dashboards by controlling which network metrics are collected.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Functions enables OpenTelemetry support
item.description:
Azure Functions now supports OpenTelemetry in general availability, allowing developers to export logs, traces, and metrics using open standards. This GA release follows the public preview and provides a production-ready observability experience.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Object Replication Metrics
item.description:
Azure Blob Storage object replication metrics for pending operations and pending bytes are now generally available in all regions, enabling customers to monitor replication status and act on delays.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Observed capacity metric in Azure Firewall
item.description:
Azure Firewall now includes the observed capacity metric (Generally Available). The metric reports the number of capacity units actively utilized over time to help administrators understand how their firewalls are scaling in practice.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Actions Runner Controller release 0.13.0
item.description:
Actions Runner Controller (ARC) 0.13.0 is released with updates that improve storage, networking, platform compatibility, and metrics. The release adds support for container lifecycle hooks to remove previous storage limitations.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: k8s: Introducing Headlamp Plugin for Karpenter - Scaling and Visibility
item.description:
The Headlamp Karpenter Plugin integrates Karpenter autoscaling visibility into the Headlamp Kubernetes UI, providing real‑time maps, metrics, scaling decisions, pending‑pod diagnostics, and an editable, validated config editor to help users understand, debug, and tune node provisioning and autoscaling behavior.

  • Source: Kubernetes Official Blog

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Visualize New Azure Resource Manager Metrics through Azure Monitor
item.description:
Azure Resource Manager (ARM) is generally available with enhanced integration into Azure Monitor Metrics, enabling subscription-level visualization of new ARM metrics for deeper visibility and more granular monitoring of Resource Manager operations.

  • Source: Azure Updates
